org.osgeo.mapguide

Class MgByteReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.osgeo.mapguide.MgObject
      • org.osgeo.mapguide.MgDisposable
        • org.osgeo.mapguide.MgGuardDisposable
          • org.osgeo.mapguide.MgSerializable
            • org.osgeo.mapguide.MgByteReader

  • public class MgByteReader
extends MgSerializable
    Reads data from a byte source. Once read, the data in the reader cannot be reread.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.osgeo.mapguide.MgObject

        swigCMemOwn

      • MgByteReader

        public MgByteReader(java.lang.String fileName,
                    java.lang.String mimeType,
                    boolean removeFile)
        Creates a byte reader from a file
        Parameters:
        fileName - (string/String/string) Name of file on disk.
        mimeType - (string/String/string) Mime type for content
        removeFile - (bool) Remove file when byte reader is deleted

      • MgByteReader

        public MgByteReader(java.lang.String contents,
                    java.lang.String mimeType)
        Creates a byte reader from a string
        Parameters:
        contents - (string/String/string) String contents for byte reader.
        mimeType - (string/String/string) Mime type for content.

      • MgByteReader

        public MgByteReader(byte[] contents,
                    int length,
                    java.lang.String mimeType)
        Creates a byte reader from an array of bytes
        Parameters:
        contents - (Byte[]/byte[]/string) Binary contents for byte reader.
        length - (int/int/int) Length of contents.
        mimeType - (string/String/string) Mime type for content.

      • read

        public int read(byte[] buffer,
                int length)
        Reads a buffer
        Parameters:
        buffer - (byte[]/Byte[]/string) A buffer receiving the data.
        length - (int) Maximum number of bytes to read
        Returns:
        Actual number of bytes put in the buffer. 0 means end of bytes

      • getMimeType

        public java.lang.String getMimeType()
        Gets the mime type of the data in this reader. See MgMimeType for list of possible mime types.
        Returns:
        string representing the type, for example text/xml

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the contents of the reader as a string. The mime type must be a text type, for example text/xml.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Text string of reader contents
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgInvalidArgumentException is thrown if the reader does not contain text

      • toFile

        public void toFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Writes the the contents of the reader to a file.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgFileIoException is thrown if file cannot be written

      • getLength

        public long getLength()
        Returns the remaining length of the underlying byte source. This length is adjusted for previous reads. If the returned length is zero then the underlying source may be a streaming format and the length is not known.
        Returns:
        Remaining length of underlying byte source

      • isRewindable

        public boolean isRewindable()
        Determines if the reader is rewindable.
        Returns:
        true if the source is rewindable, false otherwise.

      • rewind

        public void rewind()
        Rewinds to the start of the reader. Depending on the source of the reader, Rewind may not be supported. Readers sourced from true streams cannot be rewound.
        Throws:
        MgException - with code MgIoException if reader cannot be rewound
